title: When you stop CSing to watch the Fiora v Xin Zhao
body:
And they be going at it like 
http://i.imgur.com/1ZLdlJa.gif

replies.body:
It's a known rule of the interwebz to add the name of the anime to the gif post.
OP you have exactly 24 hours to add the name of the anime this gif origins from or else I'll contact Infinity Ward and make sure they ban your Call of Duty account.

It's Ufotable's Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works.
Fun fact: this isn't sped up, it's nicknamed unlimited budget works for a reason :P

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-05-13T16:06:45.226+0000)
>
> It's Ufotable's Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works.
> Fun fact: this isn't sped up, it's nicknamed unlimited budget works for a reason :P

Fun Fact #2: They were already the best animation company in the world by far as seen in their other works such as Garden of Sinners, Fate/Zero, etc. The prequel Fate/Zero they did the animation for then went on to sell absurdly well raking in several years worth of revenue further cementing their ability to put out top tier animation. I'm a fan of Kalafina as well for their music who has worked on similar projects as Ufotable.

> [{quoted}](name=Lancir,realm=OCE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-05-13T16:06:45.226+0000)
>
> It's Ufotable's Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works.
> Fun fact: this isn't sped up, it's nicknamed unlimited budget works for a reason :P

It's a tad bit sped up come on admit it:P That scene was cool though, but Lancer vs Berzerker was better.

Can't wait for Shiroe Vs Gilgamesh ooooooh fuck yeah.

I'll leave this here https://youtu.be/JU_uEdrrhXM
You tell me if its sped up :3
Damn I wish One Piece had this level of quality.
Your Call of Duty account is safe... For now
Fun fact: at least it's not the original Fate/Stay Night.
People die if they are killed
The gal on the left is almost certainly Saber, so it's probably one of the Fate/stay night spinoffs.

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-05-13T15:56:56.545+0000)
>
> The gal on the left seems to be Saber, so it's probably one of the Fate/stay night spinoffs.

It isn't a spin off it is the 2nd route with Archer/Rin. Fate Stay Night has three routes total. Heaven's Feel route is going to be a movie released in the near future.

When I said "spinoffs," I was referring to the anime based on the original VN -- "adaptation" would've been a better word to use, but I wasn't sure if the gif in question was from Fate/hollow ataraxia or Fate/zero or Fate/random phrase that sounds cool or whatever else they've released (I'm not at all familiar with Type-Moon stuff).

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2015-05-13T21:50:07.004+0000)
>
> When I said "spinoffs," I was referring to the anime based on the original VN -- "adaptation" would've been a better word to use, but I wasn't sure if the gif in question was from Fate/hollow ataraxia or Fate/zero or Fate/random phrase that sounds cool or whatever else they've released (I'm not at all familiar with Type-Moon stuff).

Ah, yeah I haven't read the VN, myself but might at some point and there is quite a bit to the Type-Moon universe. What I have seen I like. Type-Moon is like the anime version of Kojima's work, Metal Gear Solid. I wish there was more serious new content, though, rather than silly spin offs like Fate/Kaleid, Carnival, etc. that I have no intention of viewing.

I tried to start reading it, but the translation is... well, I'll just say that it's very dense. Fate/stay night is a pretty intimidating investment already, given its length, but add to that the eccentricities of its translation and the complexity of its plot, and it was more than enough to make me put it off and instead read some (somewhat) lighter fare.

have we figured out who archer is yet? My personal bets were Odysseus, and the less likely Achilles. I can't find anywhere the continued translation of the manga or anything so it has been up in the air for me for a long time.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T19:01:46.717+0000)
>
> have we figured out who archer is yet? My personal bets were Odysseus, and the less likely Achilles. I can't find anywhere the continued translation of the manga or anything so it has been up in the air for me for a long time.

Achilles has actually been used in the Fate series.  He is one of the two Rider-class servants in "Fate/Apocrypha".  As far as I'm aware, that version in the series has not yet been animated, and is only recently being translated into English.

Rider? that's weird. He should have been a lancer or saber in my opinion. He was not only a Myrmidon but the finest among them. a man who could fight and win uncontested against any other man alive had it not been for his weakness in his heel. His abilities with his sword, shield, and spear were as legendary as the strength of Hercules.

When does he ever use a horse?

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000030000,timestamp=2015-05-14T20:27:11.836+0000)
>
> Rider? that's weird. He should have been a lancer or saber in my opinion. He was not only a Myrmidon but the finest among them. a man who could fight and win uncontested against any other man alive had it not been for his weakness in his heel. His abilities with his sword, shield, and spear were as legendary as the strength of Hercules.
> 
> When does he ever use a horse?

Ever read about the Trojan War? He has chariot pulled by Zeus' bulls iirc. and Achilles' was confirmed to be able to be summoned in other Classes. Specifically Lancer.

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-05-14T04:44:34.764+0000)
>
> I tried to start reading it, but the translation is... well, I'll just say that it's very dense. Fate/stay night is a pretty intimidating investment already, given its length, but add to that the eccentricities of its translation and the complexity of its plot, and it was more than enough to make me put it off and instead read some (somewhat) lighter fare.

That's not the translation. Nasu's writing style is just very peculiar. Trust me, the H-scenes are hilariously bad (he learned his lesson and got someone else to write them in Fate/Hollow ataraxia)

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T19:47:55.105+0000)
>
> I would almost rather he was odysseus. The future alternate dimension version is certainly out of left field, but while i feel it was done for a surprise it just feels contrived to me.
> 
> done too often for originality to be original sort of thing. liked the backstory after i read it. didn't like the identity.

Not really. They mention, in canon, that the Holy Grail can pull a Servant from ANY period of time. Past or future. In fact, that's one of the first things mentioned, so it's more of a case of foreshadowing. Plus, the connection between GARcher and Shirou was hinted at early on: They used the exact same manner of spells and fighting style (Tracing to create/empower weapons, a bow and preference for dual-wielding). There's also the fact that they kind of look somewhat similar if you look closely enough.

=
=
=
=
=
=

Also on the Servants meeting requirements:

Heracles (Fate/stay night's Berserker) can be summoned as _EVERY_ class aside from Caster. Same with Lu Bu (also a Berserker, but from the video game Fate/EXTRA)


> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010000000000000003000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-15T05:19:28.185+0000)
>
> I'm sure it was said they needed the archer because it was an arrow to his heel that ultimately killed him, and not specifically because Chiron bore any divinity.
> 
> Yu are correct about the chariot but there is a flaw in that point, even if you did say your memory on the subject is hazy. (btw the chariot was used more widely known as the device in which he drug Hector's Body around the city with, not for his battles with it.)
> 
> and also a chariot is hardly any different from a carriage in that it is a form of horse drawn vehicle. the only difference being one you stand on and one you sit in. Perseus and Hercules have more claim to the rider title in that some of their mythology at one point claims that they rode a pegasus. In a chariot you body never even touches a horse. it just directs them from the reins.
> 
> The saber point only mildly surprises me though. In Fate/stay Night saber was mentioned to be an ultimate all around-er. Achilles on the other hand while being proficient in the sword excelled mostly in the spear. On the other hand, Quite literally the only time Achilles is ever seen to really interact with horses though is in the humiliation of hectors corpse through the chariot drag. which does not, a horse rider make.

Servant's legends are taken into account. The desecration of Hector's corpse is one of the more well-known things about Achilles, hence him being a Rider. Kind of like how F/SN's Rider is Medusa, because her blood made Pegasus.


Also, nononono, you see the Saber _CLASS_ is the most well-rounded in terms of Stats. IE: It's the best all-arounder. A Berserker like, say Heracles, would kick the shit out the average Saber because his Strength and Endurance is stupidly high (A+ STR, A END). What's funnier is he's actually at his weakest because he can't use his Noble Phantasm due to Mad Enhancement (which is good, because that thing is broken as fuck).

For an example of what kind of broken monster the Berserker class is when it can use their Noble Phantasms properly: See the Fourth Holy Grail War, Fate/Zero, and the Berserker there (hint: He's a Knight of the Round table, and the Lancer to King Arthur). 

Due to his Rank A+ _Eternal Arms Mastership_ skill and the Noble Phantasm _Knight of Honor_, he can use any weapon as though he had trained with it his entire life, even if it's totally alien to the person he was in life. Because he recognizes a fighter jet as a weapon, he can first turn it into his Noble Phantasm and then fly it far better than any human pilot. His second Noble Phantasm, _For Someone's Glory_ lets him distort and alter his appearance, giving him the ability to disguise himself to be anyone, including other servants like when he convincingly disguises himself as Iskander. If not for Mad Enhancement, he could have spent the entire War pretending to be other Servants sowing chaos among the other Masters. Strength? A. Agility? A+. Endurance? A. Using his third Noble Phantasm _Arondight_ and getting a stat boost on top of all that? Come on, man, quit hogging all the badass!

.........

Well... glad to see that I'm not the only one who enjoys doing extensive research on the Fate series. lol.

You are correct in every point on Fate/Zero's Berserker (I DO know who he is, but I don't want to spoil anything on anyone who doesn't).  I mean, he went toe-to-toe with Gilgamesh a couple of times and only "lost" because he got distracted when he saw Saber!!!  Catching Gilgamesh's treasures and using them against him?  **WATCH OUT!!!** But if Heracles could use his Noble Phantasms (other than his 12 lives)?  I'm not sure which one would be more dangerous...

The one thing that I have to correct you on, BlackSunNocturne, is your point about LuBu.  He can't be a Caster class or a Saber class.  Minor point there, not too big, but I thought I'd point that out.  Or am I perhaps the one mistaken since I was using a Wiki, which isn't always exactly reliable?

> [{quoted}](name=animeboy2428,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010000000000000003000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-18T18:55:07.053+0000)

>

> You are correct in every point on Fate/Zero's Berserker (I DO know who he is, but I don't want to spoil anything on anyone who doesn't).  I mean, he went toe-to-toe with Gilgamesh a couple of times and only "lost" because he got distracted when he saw Saber!!!  Catching Gilgamesh's treasures and using them against him?  **WATCH OUT!!!** But if Heracles could use his Noble Phantasms (other than his 12 lives)?  I'm not sure which one would be more dangerous...
> 
> The one thing that I have to correct you on, BlackSunNocturne, is your point about LuBu.  He can't be a Caster class or a Saber class.  Minor point there, not too big, but I thought I'd point that out.  Or am I perhaps the one mistaken since I was using a Wiki, which isn't always exactly reliable?

Nope, I was mistaken on Lu Bu. But that's only because I forgot about that LU BU CANNOT BE A PUNY MAGI!

> [{quoted}](name=BlackSunNocturne,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000030000000100000000,timestamp=2015-05-21T00:34:06.835+0000)
>
> Nope, I was mistaken on Lu Bu. But that's only because I forgot about that LU BU CANNOT BE A PUNY MAGI!

lol.

But seriously, if Heracles was able to use Noble Phantasms, who would be more terrifying to fight?  Him, or Lancelot (this is going by them both being Berserkers, though they both DO qualify to be summoned into various other classes as well)?

> [{quoted}](name=animeboy2428,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000000000300000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-21T15:23:36.758+0000)
>
> lol.
> 
> But seriously, if Heracles was able to use Noble Phantasms, who would be more terrifying to fight?  Him, or Lancelot (this is going by them both being Berserkers, though they both DO qualify to be summoned into various other classes as well)?

Heracles is stronger, so his attacks would be stronger. Because his other Noble Phantasm (Nine Lives) is kind of like Tsubame Gaeshi, but instead of 3 strikes it's _9 Near-simultaneous ones_. However, Lancelot is faster. And a Berserker's best strength in Fate is their speed and strength. It's literally a case of "If I hit you once, you're dead, but I can't hit you" between those two.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackSunNocturne,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010000000000000003000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-21T17:49:58.429+0000)
>
> Heracles is stronger, so his attacks would be stronger. Because his other Noble Phantasm (Nine Lives) is kind of like Tsubame Gaeshi, but instead of 3 strikes it's _9 Near-simultaneous ones_. However, Lancelot is faster. And a Berserker's best strength in Fate is their speed and strength. It's literally a case of "If I hit you once, you're dead, but I can't hit you" between those two.

I thought Heracles had 12 lives, not 9. Or am I mistaken there?

> [{quoted}](name=animeboy2428,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000030000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-21T18:12:01.807+0000)
>
> I thought Heracles had 12 lives, not 9. Or am I mistaken there?

_God Hand_ is the Noble Phantasm that gives Heracles 12 lives. _Nine Lives_ is the Noble Phantasm he can't use due to Mad Enhancement. Here's the description:

"Nine Lives: The Shooting Hundred Heads (One Hundred Arrow Strikes in Fate/unlimited codes) is the most trusted of all of Heracles' Noble Phantasms, but it is not utilized during Fate/stay night because he lacks the motor skills to use it while in the Berserker class. It originally had the form of the bow and arrows used to simultaneously exterminate the one hundred heads of the Hydra, an immortal nine-headed serpent, that would grow back no matter how many times they were cut down. Upon slaying the Hydra, he became able to utilize techniques that emulate the ability of the Noble Phantasm with other weapons, transforming it into an all-purpose Noble Phantasm capable of adapting and changing how it appears depending on the target and circumstances of its use.

No matter if it is delivered with a bow, large sword, shield, spear, or axe, the technique still boasts power on the level of Noble Phantasms. In essence, it is “a high speed attack consisting of nine consecutive strikes, as swift as if the attacks are overlapping.” It changes form depending on the target, such as the Anti-Unit Nine Lives Blade Works with a series of slashes and the anti-phantasm beast skill that discharges nine dragon-like homing lasers at the enemy. The skill can be called a style of its own that has a nature similar to Cú Chulainn's Gae Bolg: Barbed Spear that Pierces with Death, a technique that is part of Gae Bolg, as Heracles' technique shares name with the original Noble Phantasm. The ability would be best suited for the Saber class even though the Archer class is the most suitable to Heracles."

> [{quoted}](name=animeboy2428,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=00010000000000000003000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-21T22:59:02.434+0000)
>
> Okay! I give up. You got me beat, BIG TIME! Even I didn't do quite THAT much research into the whole thing! lol
> 
> I'm still waiting to get a solid English version of Fate/Apocrypha.  All I know about that iteration of the series is stuff that I've been able to research online, such as the 14 servants that take part in it's version of the story.

There's the Type-MOON Wiki, which is where I get most/all of my information that's not directly from the Fate/ series itself.

Okay! I give up. You got me beat, BIG TIME! Even I didn't do quite THAT much research into the whole thing! lol

I'm still waiting to get a solid English version of Fate/Apocrypha.  All I know about that iteration of the series is stuff that I've been able to research online, such as the 14 servants that take part in it's version of the story.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000030000,timestamp=2015-05-14T20:27:11.836+0000)
>
> Rider? that's weird. He should have been a lancer or saber in my opinion. He was not only a Myrmidon but the finest among them. a man who could fight and win uncontested against any other man alive had it not been for his weakness in his heel. His abilities with his sword, shield, and spear were as legendary as the strength of Hercules.
> 
> When does he ever use a horse?

According to the research I did, Achilles DID meet the requirements to be summoned into the Lancer class.  As long as they've met the all the requirements, what class a servant can be summoned as is really just luck of the draw.  The wiki said nothing of his being able to be summoned as a Saber, but it DID mention that he has a small sword that he fights with while mounted.

His "ability" with the heel does come into play in that series.  He was fighting both Saber and Berserker of the "Black Faction" using a normal spear (and without a mount despite his being a rider) no problem.  The wiki says that unless his heel is targeted, he can only be harmed by servants the the "Divinity" ability of a certain rank.  It is even stated that no member of the Black Faction can win a fight against Achilles without the help of THEIR archer, who happened to be Chiron (the Centaur said to have trained most if not ALL heroes from Greek Mythology).  While I'm not sure about Chiron's "Divinity" skill, I do know that the wiki claims that he trained Achilles, thus allowing him to know to aim for his former student's heel.

As for the horse... I don't remember EXACTLY, but I believe that (when I first learned the story of Achilles in middle-school) it was said that he was riding a chariot in battle when he happened to take an arrow to his heel and be killed.  But that's if my memory serves correctly, which it doesn't always...

I'm sure it was said they needed the archer because it was an arrow to his heel that ultimately killed him, and not specifically because Chiron bore any divinity.

Yu are correct about the chariot but there is a flaw in that point, even if you did say your memory on the subject is hazy. (btw the chariot was used more widely known as the device in which he drug Hector's Body around the city with, not for his battles with it.)

and also a chariot is hardly any different from a carriage in that it is a form of horse drawn vehicle. the only difference being one you stand on and one you sit in. Perseus and Hercules have more claim to the rider title in that some of their mythology at one point claims that they rode a pegasus. In a chariot you body never even touches a horse. it just directs them from the reins.

The saber point only mildly surprises me though. In Fate/stay Night saber was mentioned to be an ultimate all around-er. Achilles on the other hand while being proficient in the sword excelled mostly in the spear. On the other hand, Quite literally the only time Achilles is ever seen to really interact with horses though is in the humiliation of hectors corpse through the chariot drag. which does not, a horse rider make.

Well, the wiki said Chiron because he was the one fighting for the Black Faction.  Plus it can't just be ANY Archer-class, because they need to know to aim for his heel.  Before we take this argument too far and start raging at each other, please understand that everything I'm telling you is purely what I remember reading of the Fate series wiki.  It said that he was a rider (though he is able to go uncontested in speed even without his mount), so that's just what I'm going with.  I'll do a little more digging through the wiki about him and see what else comes up.  Maybe there will be further explanation as to how he met the qualifications to become a Rider-class servant.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T19:01:46.717+0000)

Archer in the Unlimited Blade Works Route is actually Shiroe himself from another universe. In his timeline he made a contract with the world and became some sort of heroic spirit and his payment is to act as a counter-guardian. He was confronted with a life-changing decision and decided to make the contract in order to save alot of people and continue to save them as a spirit even after his death. Turns out he gets betrayed by his allies and gets charged and eventually executed for war crimes, despite that he still didn't hate humanity. But the world ironically made him a spirit who's purpose is to cut down all humans who threaten the balance and the world at any given location, thus a "counter" guardian. He got his wish granted, but he has to slaughter humans to keep the peace and protect the inocents, instead of saving everyone in general. indulge yourself on the wiki:http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Archer_%28Fate/stay_night%29

Wow... You REALLY did your research.  That's not bad though.  A part of me is surprisingly happy that I'm not the ONLY one who goes and does research on the Fate series servants.

I always search through stuff I'm interested in. Literally no matter what it is, if I'm that interested, I overcome my reservations of spoiling myself in what's to come. After all, seeing it fleshed out in an episode can't compare with whatever you read in a wiki, or a manga.

> [{quoted}](name=Ironhold,realm=EUNE,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-14T19:19:15.874+0000)

lol. I think I have to agree with you there.

I would almost rather he was odysseus. The future alternate dimension version is certainly out of left field, but while i feel it was done for a surprise it just feels contrived to me.

done too often for originality to be original sort of thing. liked the backstory after i read it. didn't like the identity.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T19:47:55.105+0000)
>
> I would almost rather he was odysseus. The future alternate dimension version is certainly out of left field, but while i feel it was done for a surprise it just feels contrived to me.
> 
> done too often for originality to be original sort of thing. liked the backstory after i read it. didn't like the identity.

They drop a ton of clues though, so it's not really out of left field.  They show archer also having the 1 of a kind pendant, shirou replicates the same swords, archer's unexplained obsession with shirou, and lots of dialogue that kind of hinted at it if you were looking for it.  I thought it was a nice way to say hero's aren't just something of the past, there will be ones in the future too and the summoning isn't bound by time. 

I think it's kind of funny people have their minds blown when mainstream media (movies, tv shows, books) use these concepts, but when it's an anime everyone thinks it's a cheesy overused concept.  It's all about the presentation.

Meh, it's just too edgy for its own good. They are just trying to appear cool and intelectual for your average animu watcher. After all this show is riddled in cheesy cliches. But in no means is it bad, after all if it works don't fix it. In this case everything   this has to offer has already been done time and again, and since they cater to teenagers(shonen iirc), they have to have something a bit more thoroughly built out to keep the viewers hooked. If it wasn't for the stellar animation quality this would be another average popcorn animu. But that is(as everything mentioned here) my own personal opinion. Hopefully Heaven's Feel will give me some closure as for where this series is going, I hope for the best.

> [{quoted}](name=Sinlaire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=egKrYqbl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T19:01:46.717+0000)
>
> have we figured out who archer is yet? My personal bets were Odysseus, and the less likely Achilles. I can't find anywhere the continued translation of the manga or anything so it has been up in the air for me for a long time.

He is Shiro and a hero from the future. He isn't actually a heroic spirit but a guardian. A bow is his main weapon, but he doesn't truly have his own weapon so much as his imitations. His true nature is that of a mage, not a swordsmen or archer.

I'm 90% sure Archer is Shiro from the future.

They have the same fighting style, physique, spells, and Archer just acts out of character around him.

That's just my own speculation based on stuff that's in the show, so I'm probably wrong.
